intro: Castratella, commonly known as the "devil's backbone," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Castratella is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
